info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 3:18PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PLUMAS COUNTY THROUGH 400 PM PDT... At 316 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Frenchman Lake, or 7 miles northeast of Beckwourth. These storms are slowly moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, heavy rain, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Beckwourth, Vinton, Lake Davis, Grizzly Campground, Frenchman Lake, Chilcoot-Vinton, Big Cove Campground, Chilcoot Campground, Grasshopper Flat Campground, Frenchman Campground, Spring Creek Campground, and Beckwourth-Nervino Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Reduce speed while driving in areas of heavy rain and low visibility.
